question: A company plans to use an Amazon Snowball Edge device to transfer files to the AWS Cloud.\nWhich activities related to a Snowball Edge device are available to the company at no cost?

options.A: Use of the Snowball Edge appliance for a 10-day period
options.B: The transfer of data out of Amazon S3 and to the Snowball Edge appliance
options.C: The transfer of data from the Snowball Edge appliance into Amazon S3
options.D: Daily use of the Snowball Edge appliance after 10 days

question: A company has deployed applications on Amazon EC2 instances. The company needs to assess application vulnerabilities and must identify infrastructure deployments that do not meet best practices.\nWhich AWS service can the company use to meet these requirements?

A company has a centralized group of users with large file storage requirements that have exceeded the space available on premises. The company wants to extend its file storage capabilities for this group while retaining the performance benefit of sharing content locally.\nWhat is the MOST operationally efficient AWS solution for this scenario?

options.A: Create an Amazon S3 bucket for each user. Mount each bucket by using an S3 file system mounting utility.
options.B: Configure and deploy an AWS Storage Gateway file gateway. Connect each user’s workstation to the file gateway.
options.C: Move each user’s working environment to Amazon WorkSpaces. Set up an Amazon WorkDocs account for each user.
options.D: Deploy an Amazon EC2 instance and attach an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) Provisioned IOPS volume. Share the EBS volume directly with the users.

question: According to security best practices, how should an Amazon EC2 instance be given access to an Amazon S3 bucket?

options.A: Hard code an IAM user’s secret key and access key directly in the application, and upload the file.
options.B: Store the IAM user’s secret key and access key in a text file on the EC2 instance, read the keys, then upload the file.
options.C: Have the EC2 instance assume a role to obtain the privileges to upload the file.
options.D: Modify the S3 bucket policy so that any service can upload to it at any time.

question: Which option is a customer responsibility when using Amazon DynamoDB under the AWS Shared Responsibility Model?

options.D: Encryption of data at rest in DynamoDB

question: Which option is a perspective that includes foundational capabilities of the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF)?

A company is running and managing its own Docker environment on Amazon EC2 instances. The company wants an alternative to help manage cluster size, scheduling, and environment maintenance.\nWhich AWS service meets these requirements?
A company wants to run a NoSQL database on Amazon EC2 instances.\nWhich task is the responsibility of AWS in this scenario?

options.A: Update the guest operating system of the EC2 instances.
options.B: Maintain high availability at the database layer.
options.C: Patch the physical infrastructure that hosts the EC2 instances.

question: Which AWS services or tools can identify rightsizing opportunities for Amazon EC2 instances? (Choose two.)
Which of the following are benefits of using AWS Trusted Advisor? (Choose two.)

options.C: Detecting underutilized resources to save costs
options.D: Improving security by proactively monitoring the AWS environment
options.E: Implementing enforced tagging across AWS resources

question: Which of the following is an advantage that users experience when they move on-premises workloads to the AWS Cloud?

options.A: Elimination of expenses for running and maintaining data centers
options.B: Price discounts that are identical to discounts from hardware providers
options.C: Distribution of all operational controls to AWS

question: A company wants to manage deployed IT services and govern its infrastructure as code (IaC) templates.\nWhich AWS service will meet this requirement?
Which AWS service or tool helps users visualize, understand, and manage spending and usage over time?

A company is using a central data platform to manage multiple types of data for its customers. The company wants to use AWS services to discover, transform, and visualize the data.\nWhich combination of AWS services should the company use to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

A global company wants to migrate its third-party applications to the AWS Cloud. The company wants help from a global team of experts to complete the migration faster and more reliably in accordance with AWS internal best practices.\nWhich AWS service or resource will meet these requirements?

An e-learning platform needs to run an application for 2 months each year. The application will be deployed on Amazon EC2 instances. Any application downtime during those 2 months must be avoided.\nWhich EC2 purchasing option will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
A developer wants to deploy an application quickly on AWS without manually creating the required resources.\nWhich AWS service will meet these requirements?

A company is storing sensitive customer data in an Amazon S3 bucket. The company wants to protect the data from accidental deletion or overwriting.\nWhich S3 feature should the company use to meet these requirements?
Which AWS service provides the ability to manage infrastructure as code?

An online gaming company needs to choose a purchasing option to run its Amazon EC2 instances for 1 year. The web traffic is consistent, and any increases in traffic are predictable. The EC2 instances must be online and available without any disruption.\nWhich EC2 instance purchasing option will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
Which AWS service or feature allows a user to establish a dedicated network connection between a company’s on-premises data center and the AWS Cloud?
Which option is a physical location of the AWS global infrastructure?

A company wants to protect its AWS Cloud information, systems, and assets while performing risk assessment and mitigation tasks.\nWhich pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework is supported by these goals?
What is the purpose of having an internet gateway within a VPC?

options.A: To create a VPN connection to the VPC
options.B: To allow communication between the VPC and the internet
options.C: To impose bandwidth constraints on internet traffic
options.D: To load balance traffic from the internet across Amazon EC2 instances

question: A company is running a monolithic on-premises application that does not scale and is difficult to maintain. The company has a plan to migrate the application to AWS and divide the application into microservices.\nWhich best practice of the AWS Well-Architected Framework is the company following with this plan?

options.A: Integrate functional testing as part of AWS deployment.
options.C: Deploy the application to multiple locations.

question: A company has an AWS account. The company wants to audit its password and access key rotation details for compliance purposes.\nWhich AWS service or tool will meet this requirement?
A company wants to receive a notification when a specific AWS cost threshold is reached.\nWhich AWS services or tools can the company use to meet this requirement? (Choose two.)
Which AWS service or resource provides answers to the most frequently asked security-related questions that AWS receives from its users?
Which tasks are customer responsibilities, according to the AWS shared responsibility model? (Choose two.)

options.A: Configure the AWS provided security group firewall.
options.B: Classify company assets in the AWS Cloud.
options.C: Determine which Availability Zones to use for Amazon S3 buckets.
options.E: Select Amazon EC2 instances to run AWS Lambda on.

question: Which of the following are pillars of the AWS Well-Architected Framework? (Choose two.)
Which AWS service or feature is used to send both text and email messages from distributed applications?
A user needs programmatic access to AWS resources through the AWS CLI or the AWS API.\nWhich option will provide the user with the appropriate access?

options.D: AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) keys

question: A company runs thousands of simultaneous simulations using AWS Batch. Each simulation is stateless, is fault tolerant, and runs for up to 3 hours.\nWhich pricing model enables the company to optimize costs and meet these requirements?

options.A: The speed at which AWS resources are implemented
options.B: The speed at which AWS creates new AWS Regions
options.E: The low cost of entry into cloud computing

question: A company needs to block SQL injection attacks.\nWhich AWS service or feature can meet this requirement?
Which AWS service or feature identifies whether an Amazon S3 bucket or an IAM role has been shared with an external entity?
A cloud practitioner needs to obtain AWS compliance reports before migrating an environment to the AWS Cloud.\nHow can these reports be generated?

options.B: Download the reports from AWS Artifact.
options.C: Open a case with AWS Support.
options.D: Generate the reports with Amazon Macie.

question: An ecommerce company has migrated its IT infrastructure from an on-premises data center to the AWS Cloud.\nWhich cost is the company’s direct responsibility?

options.B: Cost of the hardware infrastructure on AWS
options.C: Cost of power for the AWS servers
options.D: Cost of physical security for the AWS data center

question: A company is setting up AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) on an AWS account.\nWhich recommendation complies with IAM security best practices?

options.A: Use the account root user access keys for administrative tasks.
options.B: Grant broad permissions so that all company employees can access the resources they need.
options.C: Turn on multi-factor authentication (MFA) for added security during the login process.
options.D: Avoid rotating credentials to prevent issues in production applications.

question: Elasticity in the AWS Cloud refers to which of the following? (Choose two.)

options.A: How quickly an Amazon EC2 instance can be restarted
options.B: The ability to rightsize resources as demand shifts
options.C: The maximum amount of RAM an Amazon EC2 instance can use
options.E: How easily resources can be procured when they are needed

question: Which service enables customers to audit API calls in their AWS accounts?

options.A: Managing the code within the Lambda function
options.B: Confirming that the hardware is working in the data center
options.D: Shutting down Lambda functions when they are no longer in use

question: A company has 5 TB of data stored in Amazon S3. The company plans to occasionally run queries on the data for analysis.\nWhich AWS service should the company use to run these queries in the MOST cost-effective manner?

Which AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) capability belongs to the people perspective?

A company wants to make an upfront commitment for continued use of its production Amazon EC2 instances in exchange for a reduced overall cost.\nWhich pricing options meet these requirements with the LOWEST cost? (Choose two.)

A company wants to migrate its on-premises relational databases to the AWS Cloud. The company wants to use infrastructure as close to its current geographical location as possible.\nWhich AWS service or resource should the company use to select its Amazon RDS deployment area?

A company is exploring the use of the AWS Cloud, and needs to create a cost estimate for a project before the infrastructure is provisioned.\nWhich AWS service or feature can be used to estimate costs before deployment?
A company is building an application that needs to deliver images and videos globally with minimal latency.\nWhich approach can the company use to accomplish this in a cost effective manner?

options.A: Deliver the content through Amazon CloudFront.
options.B: Store the content on Amazon S3 and enable S3 cross-region replication.
options.C: Implement a VPN across multiple AWS Regions.
options.D: Deliver the content through AWS PrivateLink.

question: Which option is a benefit of the economies of scale based on the advantages of cloud computing?

options.A: The ability to trade variable expense for fixed expense
options.C: Lower variable costs over fixed costs
options.D: Increased operational costs across data centers

question: Which of the following is a software development framework that a company can use to define cloud resources as code and provision the resources through AWS CloudFormation?

Which AWS service is always provided at no charge?

Which AWS service gives users the ability to discover and protect sensitive data that is stored in Amazon S3 buckets?
Which of the following services can be used to block network traffic to an instance? (Choose two.)

options.B: Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) flow logs

Which AWS service can run a managed PostgreSQL database that provides online transaction processing (OLTP)?

Which AWS service is a key-value database that provides sub-millisecond latency on a large scale?

The company has a few VPCs in a single AWS Region and expects to increase the number of VPCs to hundreds over time.\nWhich AWS service or feature should the engineer use to simplify and scale this connectivity as the VPCs increase in number?

Which AWS service is used to provide encryption for Amazon EBS?

Which of the following are advantages of the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)

options.A: Trade variable expenses for capital expenses

options.A: The ability to turn over the responsibility for all security to AWS.
options.B: The ability to use the pay-as-you-go model.
options.C: The ability to have full control over the physical infrastructure.

options.A: Reduce downtime by making infrastructure changes infrequently and in large increments.
options.B: Invest the time to configure infrastructure manually.
options.C: Learn to improve from operational failures.
options.D: Use monolithic application design for centralization.

question: Using AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) to grant access only to the resources needed to perform a task is a concept known as:
Which AWS service or tool can be used to set up a firewall to control traffic going into and coming out of an Amazon VPC subnet?
A company wants to operate a data warehouse to analyze data without managing the data warehouse infrastructure.\nWhich AWS service will meet this requirement?

options.A: AWS charges the same prices for services in every AWS Region.
options.B: AWS enables capacity to be adjusted on demand.
options.C: AWS offers discounts for Amazon EC2 instances that remain idle for more than 1 week.
options.D: AWS does not charge for data sent from the AWS Cloud to the internet.
options.E: AWS eliminates many of the costs of building and maintaining on-premises data centers.

The company wants to use AWS services for the backups without changing its existing backup workflows.\nWhich AWS service should the company use to meet these requirements?

Which tasks are the customer’s responsibility, according to the AWS shared responsibility model? (Choose two.)

options.A: Grant the developer access to only the AWS resources needed to perform the job.

options.D: Configure a password policy that ensures the developer’s password cannot be changed.

options.A: Trade variable expense for fixed expense

A large company has multiple departments. Each department has its own AWS account. Each department has purchased Amazon EC2 Reserved Instances.
Some departments do not use all the Reserved Instances that they purchased, and other departments need more Reserved Instances than they purchased.
The company needs to manage the AWS accounts for all the departments so that the departments can share the Reserved Instances.
Which AWS service or tool should the company use to meet these requirements?
Which component of the AWS global infrastructure is made up of one or more discrete data centers that have redundant power, networking, and connectivity?\n
Which duties are the responsibility of a company that is using AWS Lambda? (Choose two.)\n
Which AWS services or features provide disaster recovery solutions for Amazon EC2 instances? (Choose two.)\n

options.C: Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) snapshots

question: A company is migrating to the AWS Cloud instead of running its infrastructure on premises.\nWhich of the following are advantages of this migration? (Choose two.)\n

options.A: Elimination of the need to perform security auditing
options.C: Ability to deploy globally in minutes
options.D: Elimination of the cost of IT staff members
options.E: Redundancy by default for all compute services

question: A user is comparing purchase options for an application that runs on Amazon EC2 and Amazon RDS. The application cannot sustain any interruption. The application experiences a predictable amount of usage, including some seasonal spikes that last only a few weeks at a time. It is not possible to modify the application.\nWhich purchase option meets these requirements MOST cost-effectively?\n

options.A: Review the AWS Marketplace and buy Partial Upfront Reserved Instances to cover the predicted and seasonal load.
options.B: Buy Reserved Instances for the predicted amount of usage throughout the year. Allow any seasonal usage to run on Spot Instances.
options.C: Buy Reserved Instances for the predicted amount of usage throughout the year. Allow any seasonal usage to run at an On-Demand rate.
options.D: Buy Reserved Instances to cover all potential usage that results from the seasonal usage.

question: A company wants to review its monthly costs of using Amazon EC2 and Amazon RDS for the past year.\nWhich AWS service or tool provides this information?\n

A company wants to migrate a critical application to AWS. The application has a short runtime. The application is invoked by changes in data or by shifts in system state. The company needs a compute solution that maximizes operational efficiency and minimizes the cost of running the application.\nWhich AWS solution should the company use to meet these requirements?\n
Which AWS service or feature allows users to connect with and deploy AWS services programmatically?\n
A company plans to create a data lake that uses Amazon S3.\nWhich factor will have the MOST effect on cost?\n

options.A: The selection of S3 storage tiers
options.B: Charges to transfer existing data into Amazon S3
options.C: The addition of S3 bucket policies
options.D: S3 ingest fees for each request

question:
A company is launching an ecommerce application that must always be available. The application will run on Amazon EC2 instances continuously for the next
12 months.
What is the MOST cost-effective instance purchasing option that meets these requirements?
Which AWS service or feature can a company use to determine which business unit is using specific AWS resources?\n
A company wants to migrate its workloads to AWS, but it lacks expertise in AWS Cloud computing.\nWhich AWS service or feature will help the company with its migration?\n
Which AWS service or tool should a company use to centrally request and track service limit increases?\n
Which documentation does AWS Artifact provide?\n

options.C: A history of a company's AWS spending
options.D: A list of previous-generation Amazon EC2 instance types

question: Which task requires using AWS account root user credentials?\n

options.C: Starting and stopping Amazon EC2 instances

question: A company needs to simultaneously process hundreds of requests from different users.\nWhich combination of AWS services should the company use to build an operationally efficient solution?\n

options.A: Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) and AWS Lambda
options.B: AWS Data Pipeline and Amazon EC2

question: What is the scope of a VPC within the AWS network?\n

options.A: A VPC can span all Availability Zones globally.
options.B: A VPC must span at least two subnets in each AWS Region.
options.C: A VPC must span at least two edge locations in each AWS Region.
options.D: A VPC can span all Availability Zones within an AWS Region.

question: Which of the following are components of an AWS Site-to-Site VPN connection? (Choose two.)\n

A company needs to establish a connection between two VPCs. The VPCs are located in two different AWS Regions. The company wants to use the existing infrastructure of the VPCs for this connection.\nWhich AWS service or feature can be used to establish this connection?\n
According to the AWS shared responsibility model, what responsibility does a customer have when using Amazon RDS to host a database?\n
What are some advantages of using Amazon EC2 instances to host applications in the AWS Cloud instead of on premises? (Choose two.)\n

options.A: EC2 includes operating system patch management.
options.B: EC2 integrates with Amazon VPC, AWS CloudTrail, and AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM).
options.C: EC2 has a 100% service level agreement (SLA).
options.D: EC2 has a flexible, pay-as-you-go pricing model.
options.E: EC2 has automatic storage cost optimization.

question: A user needs to determine whether an Amazon EC2 instance's security groups were modified in the last month.\nHow can the user see if a change was made?\n

options.A: Use Amazon EC2 to see if the security group was changed.
options.B: Use AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) to see which user or role changed the security group.
options.C: Use AWS CloudTrail to see if the security group was changed.
options.D: Use Amazon CloudWatch to see if the security group was changed.

question: Which AWS service will help protect applications running on AWS from DDoS attacks?\n
Which AWS service or feature acts as a firewall for Amazon EC2 instances?\n
How does the AWS Cloud pricing model differ from the traditional on-premises storage pricing model?\n

options.A: AWS resources do not incur costs
options.B: There are no infrastructure operating costs
options.C: There are no upfront cost commitments
options.D: There are no software licensing costs

question: A company has a single Amazon EC2 instance. The company wants to adopt a highly available architecture.\nWhat can the company do to meet this requirement?\n

options.A: Scale vertically to a larger EC2 instance size.
options.B: Scale horizontally across multiple Availability Zones.
options.D: Change the EC2 instance family to a compute optimized instance.

question: A company's on-premises application deployment cycle was 3-4 weeks. After migrating to the AWS Cloud, the company can deploy the application in 2-3 days.\nWhich benefit has this company experienced by moving to the AWS Cloud?\n
Which of the following are included in AWS Enterprise Support? (Choose two.)\n

options.D: Support of third-party software integration to AWS

question: A global media company uses AWS Organizations to manage multiple AWS accounts.\nWhich AWS service or feature can the company use to limit the access to AWS services for member accounts?\n
A company wants to limit its employees' AWS access to a portfolio of predefined AWS resources.\nWhich AWS solution should the company use to meet this requirement?\n

An online company was running a workload on premises and was struggling to launch new products and features. After migrating the workload to AWS, the company can quickly launch products and features and can scale its infrastructure as required.\nWhich AWS Cloud value proposition does this scenario describe?\n
Which of the following are advantages of the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)\n

options.B: Ability to quickly change required capacity

question: AWS has the ability to achieve lower pay-as-you-go pricing by aggregating usage across hundreds of thousands of users.\nThis describes which advantage of the AWS Cloud?\n

A company has a database server that is always running. The company hosts the server on Amazon EC2 instances. The instance sizes are suitable for the workload. The workload will run for 1 year.\nWhich EC2 instance purchasing option will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?\n
A company is developing a mobile app that needs a high-performance NoSQL database.\nWhich AWS services could the company use for this database? (Choose two.)\n
Which tasks are the responsibility of AWS, according to the AWS shared responsibility model? (Choose two.)\n

options.A: Patch the Amazon EC2 guest operating system.
options.B: Upgrade the firmware of the network infrastructure.
options.C: Apply password rotation for IAM users.
options.D: Maintain the physical security of edge locations.
options.E: Maintain least privilege access to the root user account.

question: Which of the following are features of network ACLs as they are used in the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)\n

options.C: They evaluate all rules before allowing traffic.
options.D: They process rules in order, starting with the lowest numbered rule, when deciding whether to allow traffic.
options.E: They operate at the instance level.

question: A company has designed its AWS Cloud infrastructure to run its workloads effectively. The company also has protocols in place to continuously improve supporting processes.\nWhich pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework does this scenario represent?\n
Which AWS service or feature can be used to create a private connection between an on-premises workload and an AWS Cloud workload?\n

A company needs to graphically visualize AWS billing and usage over time. The company also needs information about its AWS monthly costs.\nWhich AWS Billing and Cost Management tool provides this data in a graphical format?\n

A company wants to run production workloads on AWS. The company needs concierge service, a designated AWS technical account manager (TAM), and technical support that is available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.\nWhich AWS Support plan will meet these requirements?\n
Which architecture design principle describes the need to isolate failures between dependent components in the AWS Cloud?\n

options.C: Design for single points of failure.

question: Which AWS services are managed database services? (Choose two.)\n

A company is using the AWS Free Tier for several AWS services for an application.\nWhat will happen if the Free Tier usage period expires or if the application use exceeds the Free Tier usage limits?\n

options.A: The company will be charged the standard pay-as-you-go service rates for the usage that exceeds the Free Tier usage.
options.B: AWS Support will contact the company to set up standard service charges.
options.C: The company will be charged for the services it consumed during the Free Tier period, plus additional charges for service consumption after the Free Tier period.
options.D: The company's AWS account will be frozen and can be restarted after a payment plan is established.

question: A company recently deployed an Amazon RDS instance in its VPC. The company needs to implement a stateful firewall to limit traffic to the private corporate network.\nWhich AWS service or feature should the company use to limit network traffic directly to its RDS instance?\n
Which AWS service uses machine learning to help discover, monitor, and protect sensitive data that is stored in Amazon S3 buckets?\n
A company wants to improve the overall availability and performance of its applications that are hosted on AWS.\nWhich AWS service should the company use?\n
Which AWS service or feature identifies whether an Amazon S3 bucket or an IAM role has been shared with an external entity?\n

A company does not want to rely on elaborate forecasting to determine its usage of compute resources. Instead, the company wants to pay only for the resources that it uses. The company also needs the ability to increase or decrease its resource usage to meet business requirements.\nWhich pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework aligns with these requirements?\n
A company wants to launch its workload on AWS and requires the system to automatically recover from failure.\nWhich pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework includes this requirement?\n

A large enterprise with multiple VPCs in several AWS Regions around the world needs to connect and centrally manage network connectivity between its VPCs.\nWhich AWS service or feature meets these requirements?\n
Which AWS service supports the creation of visual reports from AWS Cost and Usage Report data?\n
Which AWS service should be used to monitor Amazon EC2 instances for CPU and network utilization?\n

A company is preparing to launch a new web store that is expected to receive high traffic for an upcoming event. The web store runs only on AWS, and the company has an AWS Enterprise Support plan.\nWhich AWS resource will provide guidance about how the company should scale its architecture and operational support during the event?\n

options.B: The designated AWS technical account manager (TAM)

question: A user wants to deploy a service to the AWS Cloud by using infrastructure-as-code (IaC) principles.\nWhich AWS service can be used to meet this requirement?\n

A company that has multiple business units wants to centrally manage and govern its AWS Cloud environments. The company wants to automate the creation of
AWS accounts, apply service control policies (SCPs), and simplify billing processes.
Which AWS service or tool should the company use to meet these requirements?
Which IT controls do AWS and the customer share, according to the AWS shared responsibility model? (Choose two.)\n

A company is launching an application in the AWS Cloud. The application will use Amazon S3 storage. A large team of researchers will have shared access to the data. The company must be able to recover data that is accidentally overwritten or deleted.\nWhich S3 feature should the company turn on to meet this requirement?\n

options.D: Encryption in transit and at rest

question:
A manufacturing company has a critical application that runs at a remote site that has a slow internet connection. The company wants to migrate the workload to
AWS. The application is sensitive to latency and interruptions in connectivity. The company wants a solution that can host this application with minimum latency.
Which AWS service or feature should the company use to meet these requirements?

A company wants to migrate its applications from its on-premises data center to a VPC in the AWS Cloud. These applications will need to access on-premises resources.\nWhich actions will meet these requirements? (Choose two.)\n

options.A: Use AWS Service Catalog to identify a list of on-premises resources that can be migrated.
options.B: Create a VPN connection between an on-premises device and a virtual private gateway in the VPC.
options.C: Use an Amazon CloudFront distribution and configure it to accelerate content delivery close to the on-premises resources.
options.D: Set up an AWS Direct Connect connection between the on-premises data center and AWS.
options.E: Use Amazon CloudFront to restrict access to static web content provided through the on-premises web servers.

question: A company wants to use the AWS Cloud to provide secure access to desktop applications that are running in a fully managed environment.\nWhich AWS service should the company use to meet this requirement?\n

A company wants to implement threat detection on its AWS infrastructure. However, the company does not want to deploy additional software.\nWhich AWS service should the company use to meet these requirements?\n
Which AWS service uses edge locations?\n
A company needs to install an application in a Docker container.\nWhich AWS service eliminates the need to provision and manage the container hosts?\n

options.B: Amazon FSx for Windows File Server

question: Which AWS service or feature checks access policies and offers actionable recommendations to help users set secure and functional policies?\n

A company has a fleet of cargo ships. The cargo ships have sensors that collect data at sea, where there is intermittent or no internet connectivity. The company needs to collect, format, and process the data at sea and move the data to AWS later.\nWhich AWS service should the company use to meet these requirements?\n

A retail company needs to build a highly available architecture for a new ecommerce platform. The company is using only AWS services that replicate data across multiple Availability Zones.\nWhich AWS services should the company use to meet this requirement? (Choose two.)\n
Which characteristic of the AWS Cloud helps users eliminate underutilized CPU capacity?\n
Service control policies (SCPs) manage permissions for which of the following?\n
Which AWS service can be used to encrypt data at rest?\n
Which characteristics are advantages of using the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)\n

options.A: A 100% service level agreement (SLA) for all AWS services
options.B: Compute capacity that is adjusted on demand
options.C: Availability of AWS Support for code development

question: A user is storing objects in Amazon S3. The user needs to restrict access to the objects to meet compliance obligations.\nWhat should the user do to meet this requirement?\n

options.B: Tag the objects in the S3 bucket.

question: A company wants to convert video files and audio files from their source format into a format that will play on smartphones, tablets, and web browsers.\nWhich AWS service will meet these requirements?\n
Which of the following are benefits of Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling? (Choose two.)\n

options.A: Improved health and availability of applications

question: A company has several departments. Each department has its own AWS accounts for its applications. The company wants all AWS costs on a single invoice to simplify payment, but the company wants to know the costs that each department is incurring.\nWhich AWS tool or feature will provide this functionality?\n
A company runs its workloads on premises. The company wants to forecast the cost of running a large application on AWS.\nWhich AWS service or tool can the company use to obtain this information?\n

A company wants to eliminate the need to guess infrastructure capacity before deployments. The company also wants to spend its budget on cloud resources only as the company uses the resources.\nWhich advantage of the AWS Cloud matches the company's requirements?\n

Which AWS service supports a hybrid architecture that gives users the ability to extend AWS infrastructure, AWS services, APIs, and tools to data centers, co- location environments, or on-premises facilities?\n

A company has a physical tape library to store data backups. The tape library is running out of space. The company needs to extend the tape library's capacity to the AWS Cloud.\nWhich AWS service should the company use to meet this requirement?\n

An online retail company has seasonal sales spikes several times a year, primarily around holidays. Demand is lower at other times. The company finds it difficult to predict the increasing infrastructure demand for each season.\nWhich advantages of moving to the AWS Cloud would MOST benefit the company? (Choose two.)\n
Which AWS service can be used to turn text into lifelike speech?\n
Which AWS service or tool can be used to capture information about inbound and outbound traffic in an Amazon VPC?\n
A company wants to ensure that two Amazon EC2 instances are in separate data centers with minimal communication latency between the data centers.\nHow can the company meet this requirement?\n

options.A: Place the EC2 instances in two separate AWS Regions connected with a VPC peering connection.
options.B: Place the EC2 instances in two separate Availability Zones within the same AWS Region.
options.C: Place one EC2 instance on premises and the other in an AWS Region. Then connect them by using an AWS VPN connection.
options.D: Place both EC2 instances in a placement group for dedicated bandwidth.

question: In which situations should a company create an IAM user instead of an IAM role? (Choose two.)\n

options.A: When an application that runs on Amazon EC2 instances requires access to other AWS services
options.B: When the company creates AWS access credentials for individuals
options.C: When the company creates an application that runs on a mobile phone that makes requests to AWS
options.D: When the company needs to add users to IAM groups
options.E: When users are authenticated in the corporate network and want to be able to use AWS without having to sign in a second time

question: Which AWS services should a company use to read and write data that changes frequently? (Choose two.)\n
Which AWS service is used to provide encryption for Amazon EBS?\n
Which AWS services make use of global edge locations? (Choose two.)\n

A company is operating several factories where it builds products. The company needs the ability to process data, store data, and run applications with local system interdependencies that require low latency.\nWhich AWS service should the company use to meet these requirements?\n
Which of the following is a recommended design principle for AWS Cloud architecture?\n

options.B: Build a single application component that can handle all the application functionality.
options.C: Make large changes on fewer iterations to reduce chances of failure.
options.D: Avoid monolithic architecture by segmenting workloads.

question: A company is designing its AWS workloads so that components can be updated regularly and so that changes can be made in small, reversible increments.\nWhich pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework does this design support?\n
Which of the following acts as an instance-level firewall to control inbound and outbound access?\n
A company has a workload that will run continuously for 1 year. The workload cannot tolerate service interruptions.\nWhich Amazon EC2 purchasing option will be MOST cost-effective?\n
Which AWS service helps protect against DDoS attacks?\n
Using AWS Config to record, audit, and evaluate changes to AWS resources to enable traceability is an example of which AWS Well-Architected Framework pillar?\n
Which AWS tool or feature acts as a VPC firewall at the subnet level?\n
Which AWS service can be used to decouple applications?\n
Which disaster recovery option is the LEAST expensive?\n
Which type of AWS storage is ephemeral and is deleted when an Amazon EC2 instance is stopped or terminated?\n
Which of the following is a characteristic of the AWS account root user?\n

options.A: The root user is the only user that can be configured with multi-factor authentication (MFA).
options.B: The root user is the only user that can access the AWS Management Console.
options.C: The root user is the first sign-in identity that is available when an AWS account is created.
options.D: The root user has a password that cannot be changed.

question:
A company hosts an application on an Amazon EC2 instance. The EC2 instance needs to access several AWS resources, including Amazon S3 and Amazon
DynamoDB.
What is the MOST operationally efficient solution to delegate permissions?

options.A: Create an IAM role with the required permissions. Attach the role to the EC2 instance.
options.B: Create an IAM user and use its access key and secret access key in the application.
options.C: Create an IAM user and use its access key and secret access key to create a CLI profile in the EC2 instance
options.D: Create an IAM role with the required permissions. Attach the role to the administrative IAM user.

question: Which of the following is a component of the AWS Global Infrastructure?\n
What is the purpose of having an internet gateway within a VPC?\n

options.A: To create a VPN connection to the VPC
options.B: To allow communication between the VPC and the internet
options.C: To impose bandwidth constraints on internet traffic
options.D: To load balance traffic from the internet across Amazon EC2 instances

question: Which AWS service allows users to download security and compliance reports about the AWS infrastructure on demand?\n

A pharmaceutical company operates its infrastructure in a single AWS Region. The company has thousands of VPCs in a various AWS accounts that it wants to interconnect.\nWhich AWS service or feature should the company use to help simplify management and reduce operational costs?\n

A company is planning an infrastructure deployment to the AWS Cloud. Before the deployment, the company wants a cost estimate for running the infrastructure.\nWhich AWS service or feature can provide this information?\n
Which AWS service of tool helps to centrally manage billing and allow controlled access to resources across AWS accounts?\n
Which of the following are Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) resources?\n
A company needs to identify the last time that a specific user accessed the AWS Management Console.\nWhich AWS service will provide this information?\n
A company launched an Amazon EC2 instance with the latest Amazon Linux 2 Amazon Machine Image (AMI).\nWhich actions can a system administrator take to connect to the EC2 instance? (Choose two.)\n

options.B: Use a Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) connection.
options.D: Use AWS Systems Manager Session Manager.

question: A company wants to perform sentiment analysis on customer service email messages that it receives. The company wants to identify whether the customer service engagement was positive or negative.\nWhich AWS service should the company use to perform this analysis?\n
What is the total amount of storage offered by Amazon S3?\n

A company is migrating to Amazon S3. The company needs to transfer 60 TB of data from an on-premises data center to AWS within 10 days.\nWhich AWS service should the company use to accomplish this migration?\n
What type of database is Amazon DynamoDB?\n
A large organization has a single AWS account.\nWhat are the advantages of reconfiguring the single account into multiple AWS accounts? (Choose two.)\n

options.A: It allows for administrative isolation between different workloads.
options.B: Discounts can be applied on a quarterly basis by submitting cases in the AWS Management Console.
options.C: Transitioning objects from Amazon S3 to Amazon S3 Glacier in separate AWS accounts will be less expensive.
options.D: Having multiple accounts reduces the risks associated with malicious activity targeted at a single account.
options.E: Amazon QuickSight offers access to a cost tool that provides application-specific recommendations for environments running in multiple accounts.

question:
A retail company has recently migrated its website to AWS. The company wants to ensure that it is protected from SQL injection attacks. The website uses an
Application Load Balancer to distribute traffic to multiple Amazon EC2 instances.
Which AWS service or feature can be used to create a custom rule that blocks SQL injection attacks?
Which AWS service provides a feature that can be used to proactively monitor and plan for the service quotas of AWS resources?\n
Which of the following is an advantage that users experience when they move on-premises workloads to the AWS Cloud?\n

options.A: Elimination of expenses for running and maintaining data centers
options.B: Price discounts that are identical to discounts from hardware providers
options.C: Distribution of all operational controls to AWS

question: Which design principle is included in the operational excellence pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?\n
Which AWS services offer gateway VPC endpoints that can be used to avoid sending traffic over the internet? (Choose two.)\n
Which of the following is the customer responsible for updating and patching, according to the AWS shared responsibility model?\n

options.A: Amazon FSx for Windows File Server
options.C: AWS Directory Service for Microsoft Active Directory
options.D: Amazon RDS for Microsoft SQL Server

question: Who has the responsibility to patch the host operating system of an Amazon EC2 instance, according to the AWS shared responsibility model?\n

A company is using an Amazon RDS DB instance for an application that is deployed in the AWS Cloud. The company needs regular patching of the operating system of the server where the DB instance runs.\nWhat is the company's responsibility in this situation, according to the AWS shared responsibility model?\n

options.A: Open a support case to obtain administrative access to the server so that the company can patch the DB instance operating system.
options.B: Open a support case and request that AWS patch the DB instance operating system.
options.C: Use administrative access to the server, and apply the operating system patches during the regular maintenance window that is defined for the DB instance.
options.D: Establish a regular maintenance window that tells AWS when to patch the DB instance operating system.

question: Why is an AWS Well-Architected review a critical part of the cloud design process?\n

options.A: A Well-Architected review is mandatory before a workload can run on AWS.
options.B: A Well-Architected review helps identify design gaps and helps evaluate design decisions and related documents.
options.C: A Well-Architected review is an audit mechanism that is a part of requirements for service level agreements.
options.D: A Well-Architected review eliminates the need for ongoing auditing and compliance tests.

question:
A company implements an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling policy along with an Application Load Balancer to automatically recover unhealthy applications that run on
Amazon EC2 instances.
Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework does this action cover?
Which AWS Cloud benefit is shown by an architecture's ability to withstand failures with minimal downtime?\n
Under the AWS shared responsibility model, which task is the customer's responsibility when managing AWS Lambda functions?\n

options.C: Scaling Lambda resources according to demand

question: What does the AWS Concierge Support team provide?\n

options.A: A technical expert dedicated to the user
options.B: A primary point of contact for AWS Billing and AWS Support
options.C: A partner to help provide scaling guidance for an event launch
options.D: A dedicated AWS staff member who reviews the user's application architecture

question: A company needs to generate reports that can break down cloud costs by product, by company-defined tags, and by hour, day, and month.\nWhich AWS tool should the company use to meet these requirements?\n

options.A: Reserved Instance utilization and coverage reports

question: A company has a serverless application that includes an Amazon API Gateway API, an AWS Lambda function, and an Amazon DynamoDB database.\nWhich AWS service can the company use to trace user requests as they move through the application's components?\n
A company needs to set up a petabyte-scale data warehouse in the AWS Cloud.\nWhich AWS service will meet this requirement?\n
Which AWS service is always provided at no charge?\n
A company needs to design an AWS disaster recovery plan to cover multiple geographic areas.\nWhich action will meet this requirement?\n

options.B: Configure the architecture across multiple Availability Zones in an AWS Region.
options.C: Configure the architecture across multiple AWS Regions.
options.D: Configure the architecture among many edge locations.

question: Which of the following is a benefit of moving from an on-premises data center to the AWS Cloud?\n

options.A: Compute instances can be launched and terminated as needed to optimize costs.
options.B: Compute costs can be viewed in the AWS Billing and Cost Management console.
options.C: Users retain full administrative access to their compute instances.
options.D: Users can optimize costs by permanently running enough instances at peak load.

question: In which ways does the AWS Cloud offer lower total cost of ownership (TCO) of computing resources than on-premises data centers? (Choose two.)\n

options.A: AWS replaces upfront capital expenditures with pay-as-you-go costs.
options.B: AWS is designed for high availability, which eliminates user downtime.
options.C: AWS eliminates the need for on-premises IT staff.
options.D: AWS uses economies of scale to continually reduce prices.
options.E: AWS offers a single pricing model for Amazon EC2 instances.

question: Which AWS service monitors AWS accounts for security threats?\n
Which benefit is included with an AWS Enterprise Support plan?\n

options.A: AWS Partner Network (APN) support at no cost.
options.B: Designated support from an AWS technical account manager (TAM)
options.D: AWS managed compliance as code with AWS Config

question: Which task does AWS perform automatically?\n

options.A: Encrypt data that is stored in Amazon DynamoDB.
options.D: Create TLS certificates for users' websites.

question: Which AWS service or tool can a company use to visualize, understand, and manage AWS spending and usage over time?\n

A company wants to deploy some of its resources in the AWS Cloud. To meet regulatory requirements, the data must remain local and on premises. There must be low latency between AWS and the company resources.\nWhich AWS service or feature can be used to meet these requirements?\n
A company requires an isolated environment within AWS for security purposes.\nWhich action can be taken to accomplish this?\n

options.A: Create a separate Availability Zone to host the resources.
options.B: Create a separate VPC to host the resources.
options.C: Create a placement group to host the resources.
options.D: Create an AWS Direct Connect connection between the company and AWS.

question: Which AWS service is a highly available and scalable DNS web service?\n
Which of the following is an AWS best practice for managing an AWS account root user?\n

options.A: Keep the root user password with the security team.
options.B: Enable multi-factor authentication (MFA) for the root user.
options.C: Create an access key for the root user.
options.D: Keep the root user password consistent for compliance purposes.

question: A company wants to improve its security and audit posture by limiting Amazon EC2 inbound access.\nWhat should the company use to access instances remotely instead of opening inbound SSH ports and managing SSH keys?\n
After selecting an Amazon EC2 Dedicated Host reservation, which pricing option would provide the largest discount?\n
A company has refined its workload to use specific AWS services to improve efficiency and reduce cost.\nWhich best practice for cost governance does this example show?\n

A company would like to host its MySQL databases on AWS and maintain full control over the operating system, database installation, and configuration.\nWhich AWS service should the company use to host the databases?\n
How does the AWS global infrastructure offer high availability and fault tolerance to its users?\n

options.A: The AWS infrastructure is made up of multiple AWS Regions within various Availability Zones located in areas that have low flood risk, and are interconnected with low-latency networks and redundant power supplies.
options.B: The AWS infrastructure consists of subnets containing various Availability Zones with multiple data centers located in the same geographic location.
options.C: AWS allows users to choose AWS Regions and data centers so that users can select the closest data centers in different Regions.
options.D: The AWS infrastructure consists of isolated AWS Regions with independent Availability Zones that are connected with low-latency networking and redundant power supplies.

question: A company is using Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling to scale its Amazon EC2 instances.\nWhich benefit of the AWS Cloud does this example illustrate?\n
Which AWS service or feature is used to send both text and email messages from distributed applications?\n
A user is able to set up a master payer account to view consolidated billing reports through:\n
According to the AWS shared responsibility model, which task is the customer's responsibility?\n

options.A: Maintaining the infrastructure needed to run AWS Lambda
options.B: Updating the operating system of Amazon DynamoDB instances
options.D: Updating the guest operating system on Amazon EC2 instances

question: A company wants to migrate a small website and database quickly from on-premises infrastructure to the AWS Cloud. The company has limited operational knowledge to perform the migration.\nWhich AWS service supports this use case?\n
A company is moving multiple applications to a single AWS account. The company wants to monitor the AWS Cloud costs incurred by each application.\nWhat can the company do to meet this requirement?\n
Which design principle is achieved by following the reliability pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?\n

A user needs to quickly deploy a non-relational database on AWS. The user does not want to manage the underlying hardware or the database software.\nWhich AWS service can be used to accomplish this?\n
Which task is an AWS responsibility when a workload is running in Amazon RDS?\n
A development team wants to publish and manage web services that provide REST APIs.\nWhich AWS service will meet this requirement?\n

A company has a social media platform in which users upload and share photos with other users. The company wants to identify and remove inappropriate photos. The company has no machine learning (ML) scientists and must build this detection capability with no ML expertise.\nWhich AWS service should the company use to build this capability?\n
Which responsibility belongs to AWS when a company hosts its databases on Amazon EC2 instances?\n

A company wants to use Amazon S3 to store its legacy data. The data is rarely accessed. However, the data is critical and cannot be recreated. The data needs to be available for retrieval within seconds.\nWhich S3 storage class meets these requirements MOST cost-effectively?\n

options.B: S3 One Zone-Infrequent Access (S3 One Zone-IA)

question: An online retail company wants to migrate its on-premises workload to AWS. The company needs to automatically handle a seasonal workload increase in a cost- effective manner.\nWhich AWS Cloud features will help the company meet this requirement? (Choose two.)\n
Which AWS service helps developers use loose coupling and reliable messaging between microservices?\n

A company needs to build an application that uses AWS services. The application will be delivered to residents in European Counties. The company must abide by regional regulatory requirements.\nWhich AWS service or program should the company use to determine which AWS services meet the regional requirements?\n
A company needs to implement identity management for a fleet of mobile apps that are running in the AWS Cloud.\nWhich AWS service will meet this requirement?\n

A company needs an Amazon EC2 instance for a rightsized database server that must run constantly for 1 year.\nWhich EC2 instance purchasing option will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?\n

A company has multiple applications and is now building a new multi-tier application. The company will host the new application on Amazon EC2 instances. The company wants the network routing and traffic between the various applications to follow the security principle of least privilege.\nWhich AWS service or feature should the company use to enforce this principle?\n
A company's web application requires AWS credentials and authorizations to use an AWS service.\nWhich IAM entity should the company use as best practice?\n
A company is creating a document that defines the operating system patch routine for all the company's systems.\nWhich AWS resources should the company include in this document? (Choose two.)\n

options.E: Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) instances

question: Which AWS service or feature gives a company the ability to control incoming traffic and outgoing traffic for Amazon EC2 instances?\n

A company is starting to build its infrastructure in the AWS Cloud. The company wants access to technical support during business hours. The company also wants general architectural guidance as teams build and test new applications.\nWhich AWS Support plan will meet these requirements at the LOWEST cost?\n
A company is migrating its public website to AWS. The company wants to host the domain name for the website on AWS.\nWhich AWS service should the company use to meet this requirement?\n

A company needs to evaluate its AWS environment and provide best practice recommendations in five categories: cost, performance, service limits, fault tolerance, and security.\nWhich AWS service can the company use to meet these requirements?\n
Which AWS service provides the capability to view end-to-end performance metrics and troubleshoot distributed applications?\n
Which cloud computing benefit does AWS demonstrate with its ability to offer lower variable costs as a result of high purchase volumes?\n
Which AWS service provides threat detection by monitoring for malicious activities and unauthorized actions to protect AWS accounts, workloads, and data that is stored in Amazon S3?\n
Which AWS service can a company use to store and manage Docker images?\n

A company needs an automated security assessment report that will identify unintended network access to Amazon EC2 instances. The report also must identify operating system vulnerabilities on those instances.\nWhich AWS service or feature should the company use to meet this requirement?\n

A global company is building a simple time-tracking mobile app. The app needs to operate globally and must store collected data in a database. Data must be accessible from the AWS Region that is closest to the user.\nWhat should the company do to meet these data storage requirements with the LEAST amount of operational overhead?\n

options.A: Use Amazon EC2 in multiple Regions to host separate databases
options.D: Use AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS)

question: Which of the following are economic advantages of the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)\n

options.B: Decreased need to encrypt user data
options.D: Simplified total cost of ownership (TCO) accounting

question: Which controls does the customer fully inherit from AWS in the AWS shared responsibility model?\n
Which task is a customer's responsibility, according to the AWS shared responsibility model?\n

options.A: Management of the guest operating systems
options.B: Maintenance of the configuration of infrastructure devices
options.C: Management of the host operating systems and virtualization
options.D: Maintenance of the software that powers Availability Zones

question: A company needs to deliver new website features quickly in an iterative manner to minimize the time to market.\nWhich AWS Cloud concept does this requirement represent?\n
A company wants to increase its ability to recover its infrastructure in the case of a natural disaster.\nWhich pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework does this ability represent?\n
Which AWS service tracks API calls and user activity?\n
Which AWS service, feature, or tool uses machine learning to continuously monitor cost and usage for unusual cloud spending?\n

A company deployed an application on an Amazon EC2 instance. The application ran as expected for 6 months in the past week, users have reported latency issues. A system administrator found that the CPU utilization was at 100% during business hours. The company wants a scalable solution to meet demand.\nWhich AWS service or feature should the company use to handle the load for its application during periods of high demand?\n

A company wants to migrate to AWS and use the same security software it uses on premises. The security software vendor offers its security software as a service on AWS.\nWhere can the company purchase the security solution?\n

A company is generating large sets of critical data in its on-premises data center. The company needs to securely transfer the data to AWS for processing. These transfers must occur daily over a dedicated connection.\nWhich AWS service should the company use to meet these requirements?\n

The company also wants access to the AWS Health API and contextual architectural guidance for business use cases. The company has a strong IT support team and does not need concierge support.\nWhich AWS Support plan will meet these requirements at the LOWEST cost?\n
Which of the following is a managed AWS service that is used specifically for extract, transform, and load (ETL) data?\n
Which of the following actions are controlled with AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)? (Choose two.)\n

options.A: Control access to AWS service APIs and to other specific resources.
options.B: Provide intelligent threat detection and continuous monitoring.
options.C: Protect the AWS environment using multi-factor authentication (MFA).
options.D: Grant users access to AWS data centers.
options.E: Provide firewall protection for applications from common web attacks.

question: Which of the following are shared controls that apply to both AWS and the customer, according to the AWS shared responsibility model? (Choose two.)\n

options.E: Replacement and disposal of disk drives

question: What information is found on an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) credential report? (Choose two.)\n

options.A: The date and time when an IAM user's password was last used to sign in to the AWS Management Console.
options.B: The type of multi-factor authentication (MFA) device assigned to an IAM user.
options.C: The User-Agent browser identifier for each IAM user currently logged in.
options.D: Whether multi-factor authentication (MFA) has been enabled for an IAM user.
options.E: The number of incorrect login attempts by each IAM user in the previous 30 days.

question: What is the LEAST expensive AWS Support plan that contains a full set of AWS Trusted Advisor best practice checks?\n
Which AWS service provides domain registration, DNS routing, and service health checks?\n

Which AWS service should be used to migrate a company's on-premises MySQL database to Amazon RDS?\n
Which benefits does a company gain when the company moves from on-premises IT architecture to the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)\n

options.A: Reduced or eliminated tasks for hardware troubleshooting, capacity planning, and procurement
options.B: Elimination of the need for trained IT staff
options.C: Automatic security configuration of all applications that are migrated to the cloud
options.D: Elimination of the need for disaster recovery planning
options.E: Faster deployment of new features and applications

question: Which of the following is a benefit of decoupling an AWS Cloud architecture?\n

options.A: Maintain the security of the hardware that runs Amazon EC2 instances.
options.B: Patch the guest operating system of Amazon EC2 instances.
options.C: Protect the security of the AWS global infrastructure.

question: Which AWS Organizations feature can be used to track charges across multiple accounts and report the combined cost?\n

options.A: The ability to configure AWS data center hypervisors
options.B: The ability to purchase hardware in advance of increased traffic
options.C: The ability to deploy to AWS on a global scale
options.D: Compliance audits for user IT environments

question: An ecommerce company has migrated its IT infrastructure from an on-premises data center to the AWS Cloud.\nWhich cost is the company's direct responsibility?\n

options.B: Cost of the hardware infrastructure on AWS
options.C: Cost of power for the AWS servers
options.D: Cost of physical security for the AWS data center

question: What are the five pillars of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?\n

options.A: Encryption, documentation, speed, hybrid design, and cost optimization
options.B: Containerization, cost margins, globalization, marketplace, and developer operations
options.C: Network, compute, storage, security, and developer operations
options.D: Operational excellence, reliability, performance efficiency, security, and cost optimization

question:
A company accepts enrollment applications on handwritten paper forms. The company uses a manual process to enter the form data into its backend systems.
The company wants to automate the process by scanning the forms and capturing the enrollment data from scanned PDF files.
Which AWS service should the company use to build this process?
Which AWS service should a company use to organize, characterize, and search large numbers of images?\n

An ecommerce company wants to use Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling to add and remove EC2 instances based on CPU utilization.\nWhich AWS service or feature can initiate an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling action to achieve this goal?\n
A company wants to host a private version control system for its application code in the AWS Cloud.\nWhich AWS service should the company use to meet this requirement?\n
Which AWS service or tool can a company set up to send notifications that a custom spending threshold has been reached or exceeded?\n
Which AWS service is used to host static websites?\n
Which AWS service contains built-in engines to protect web applications that run in the cloud from SQL injection attacks and cross-site scripting?\n
A company owns per-core software licenses.\nWhich Amazon EC2 instance purchasing option must the company use for this license type?\n

A company needs to set up user authentication for a new application. Users must be able to sign in directly with a user name and password, or through a third- party provider.\nWhich AWS service should the company use to meet these requirements?\n

A company's IT team is managing MySQL database server clusters. The IT team has to patch the database and take backup snapshots of the data in the clusters.
The company wants to move this workload to AWS so that these tasks will be completed automatically.
What should the company do to meet these requirements?

options.A: Deploy MySQL database server clusters on Amazon EC2 instances.
options.B: Use Amazon RDS with a MySQL database.
options.C: Use an AWS CloudFormation template to deploy MySQL database servers on Amazon EC2 instances.
options.D: Migrate all the MySQL database data to Amazon S3.

question: What is the primary use case for Amazon GuardDuty?\n

options.C: Automatic monitoring for threats to AWS workloads

question: Which statements explain the business value of migration to the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)\n

options.A: The migration of enterprise applications to the AWS Cloud makes these applications automatically available on mobile devices.
options.B: AWS availability and security provide the ability to improve service level agreements (SLAs) while reducing risk and unplanned downtime.
options.C: Companies that migrate to the AWS Cloud eliminate the need to plan for high availability and disaster recovery.
options.D: Companies that migrate to the AWS Cloud reduce IT costs related to infrastructure, freeing budget for reinvestment in other areas.
options.E: Applications are modernized because migration to the AWS Cloud requires companies to rearchitect and rewrite all enterprise applications.

question: A company needs to identify personally identifiable information (PII), such as credit card numbers, from data that is stored in Amazon S3.\nWhich AWS service should the company use to meet this requirement?\n
Which AWS services or tools are designed to protect a workload from SQL injections, cross-site scripting, and DDoS attacks? (Choose two.)\n
A company wants to forecast future costs and usage of AWS resources based on past consumption.\nWhich AWS service or tool will provide this forecast?\n
Which AWS services use cloud-native storage that provides replication across multiple Availability Zones by default? (Choose two.)\n
Which AWS services are serverless? (Choose two.)\n

options.B: Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka

question: Which task is the responsibility of AWS, according to the AWS shared responsibility model?\n

options.A: Apply guest operating system patches to Amazon EC2 instances.
options.B: Provide monitoring of human resources information management (HRIM) systems.
options.C: Perform automated backups of Amazon RDS instances.
options.D: Optimize the costs of running AWS services.

question: A company needs to deploy a PostgreSQL database into Amazon RDS. The database must be highly available and fault tolerant.\nWhich AWS solution should the company use to meet these requirements?\n

options.A: Amazon RDS with a single Availability Zone
options.C: Amazon RDS with multiple Availability Zones

question: A company wants to add facial identification to its user verification process on an application.\nWhich AWS service should the company use to meet this requirement?\n

options.B: Use AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM).
options.D: Use the AWS Cost Management coverage report.

question: A company wants its employees to have access to virtual desktop infrastructure to securely access company-provided desktops through the employees' personal devices.\nWhich AWS service should the company use to meet these requirements?\n

options.C: Amazon FSx for Windows File Server

question: Which task can a company complete by using AWS Organizations?\n

options.B: Remove unused and underutilized AWS resources across all accounts.
options.C: Activate DDoS protection across all accounts.
options.D: Share pre-purchased Amazon EC2 resources across accounts.

question: A user has been granted permission to change their own IAM user password.\nWhich AWS services can the user use to change the password? (Choose two.)\n

The company needs an instance purchasing option that requires no long-term commitment or upfront payment.\nWhich instance purchasing option will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?\n

options.A: Validate JSON syntax from an application configuration file.
options.B: Analyze logs from an Amazon API Gateway call.
options.C: Filter traffic to or from an Amazon EC2 instance.
options.D: Grant permissions to applications that run on Amazon EC2 instances.

question: A company needs to generate reports for business intelligence and operational analytics on petabytes of semistructured and structured data. These reports are produced from standard SQL queries on data that is in an Amazon S3 data lake.\nWhich AWS service provides the ability to analyze this data?\n
